posts.title: Office Killer
posts.excerpt: SynopsisWhen Dorine Douglas’ job as proofreader for Constant Consumer magazine is turned into an at-home position during a downsizing, she doesn’t know how to cope. But after accidentally killing one of her co-workers, she discovers that murder can quench the loneliness of her home life, as a macabre office place forms in her basement, populated …

posts._title: Barbet Schroeder – L’avocat de la terreur aka Terror’s Advocate (2007)
posts.title: L’avocat de la terreur
posts.excerpt: Quote:A documentary on Jacques Vergès, the controversial lawyer and former Free French Forces guerrilla who has defended unpopular figures such as Nazi war criminal Klaus Barbie and Holocaust denier Roger Garaudy.Communist, anticolonialist, right-wing extremist? What convictions guide the moral mind of Jacques Vergès? Barbet Schroeder takes us down history’s darkest paths in his attempt to …

posts._title: Jacques Doillon & Alain Resnais & Jean Rouch – L’an 01 AKA The Year 01 (1973)
posts.title: L’an 01
posts.excerpt: Quote:The film narrates a utopian abandonment, consensual and festive of the market economy and high productivity. The population decides on a number of resolutions beginning with “We stop everything” and the second “After a total downtime will be revived-reluctantly-that the services and products including lack will prove intolerable. Probably: water to drink, electricity for reading …
posts.director: Jacques Doillon & Alain Resnais & Jean Rouch

posts.title: Monsieur Coccinelle
posts.excerpt: Quote:One of the great unknown films of the 30’s.Astonishingly inventive and constantly amusing tale ofa bureaucrat whose dead aunt proves to be irrepressibly alive.Colin Crisp – French Cinema – A Critical Filmography, Volume 1 (1929–1939)

posts.title: The BLVD
posts.excerpt: Synopsis: An experimental documentary about the street drag racing scene on Chicago’s near West Side. This is a rambling, textured film about obsession. It is about the mythos of speed for its own sake, and it is about waiting. While waiting, The BLVD exposes community, inner-city landscapes and nomadic experiences of place. The film treats …

posts.title: Die Buddenbrooks
posts.excerpt: Quote:Four-generation story-saga dealing with the decline of a middle-class Lübeck family.The first adaptation of a Thomas Mann book was also Gerhard Lamprecht’s first major film.

posts.title: Frontières
posts.excerpt: Four women from different regions develop friendships during a bus journey across West Africa, as they accomplish an everyday journey while facing the universal challenge of being independent women.

posts._title: Aleksandr Dovzhenko – Zemlya AKA Earth [84 min.] (1930)
posts.title: Zemlya
posts.excerpt: Quote:Dovzhenko’s “film poem” style brings to life the collective experience of life for the Ukranian proles, examining natural cycles through his epic montage. He explores life, death, violence, sex, and other issues as they relate to the collective farms. An idealistic vision of the possibilities of Communism made just before Stalinism set in and the …

posts.title: San Francisco
posts.excerpt: A Barbary Coast saloonkeeper and a Nob Hill impresario are rivals for the affections of a beautiful singer, both personally and professionally in 1906 San Francisco.

posts.title: Tales of Manhattan
posts.excerpt: Brief Synopsis:An actor, Paul Orman, is accidentally told that his new, custom made tail coat has been cursed and it will bring misfortune to all who wear it. As the 4 succeeding wearers of the coat discover, misfortune can often lead to truth.
